clusters.title: Bangladesh Nationalist Party wins landmark general election

items.title: Bangladesh Nationalist Party wins landmark general election
items.standfirst: Bangladesh Nationalist Party has won Bangladesh’s general election, with leader Tarique Rahman expected to form the next government after months of unrest and economic disruption in Bangladesh. The vote follows the 2024 uprising that removed former leader Sheikh Hasina, whose party was barred from running, while rival Jamaat-e-Islami, led by Shafiqur Rahman, conceded defeat and pledged constructive opposition.
items.content: Bangladesh Nationalist Party has won Bangladesh’s general election, with leader Tarique Rahman expected to form the next government after months of unrest and economic disruption in Bangladesh. The vote follows the 2024 uprising that removed former leader Sheikh Hasina, whose party was barred from running, while rival Jamaat-e-Islami, led by Shafiqur Rahman, conceded defeat and pledged constructive opposition.

items.title: Bangladesh election results 2026: Who won, who lost, what’s next?
items.standfirst: Bangladesh Nationalist Party led by Rahman has won a historic majority in the first elections after the 2024 uprising.
items.content: Bangladesh Nationalist Party led by Rahman has won a historic majority in the first elections after the 2024 uprising.

items.title: Bangladesh election: BNP wins historic first election since overthrow of Hasina
items.standfirst: Voting was largely peaceful in an election seen as a test of Bangladesh’s democracy after years of political turmoil The Bangladesh Nationalist party, led by Tarique Rahman, has won a sweeping victory in the country’s first election since a gen Z uprising toppled the autocratic regime of Sheikh Hasina.Results from the election commission confirmed the BNP alliance had won 212 seats, returning the party to power after 20 years, while the rival alliance, led by Islamist party Jamaat-e-Islami, won 77 seats. Continue reading...
items.content: Voting was largely peaceful in an election seen as a test of Bangladesh’s democracy after years of political turmoil The Bangladesh Nationalist party, led by Tarique Rahman, has won a sweeping victory in the country’s first election since a gen Z uprising toppled the autocratic regime of Sheikh Hasina.Results from the election commission confirmed the BNP alliance had won 212 seats, returning the party to power after 20 years, while the rival alliance, led by Islamist party Jamaat-e-Islami, won 77 seats. Continue reading...

items.content: Supporters of the Bangladesh Nationalist Party were seen celebrating outside the party’s office in the capital Dhaka.

items.title: Bangladesh's Nationalist Party wins majority in historic election
items.standfirst: The Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) has secured a majority victory in the country's first election since the Gen Z-driven uprising of 2024.
items.content: The Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) has secured a majority victory in the country's first election since the Gen Z-driven uprising of 2024.

items.title: Bangladesh Nationalist Party wins thumping victory in landmark post-Hasina election
items.standfirst: Bangladesh’s opposition Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP), led by Tarique Rahman, won a landslide victory in the first election since a deadly 2024 uprising, the Election Commission said Friday, winning a majority of more than two-thirds in the country's parliament. Senior BNP leader Ruhul Kabir Rizvi claimed a “sweeping victory”.
items.content: Bangladesh’s opposition Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP), led by Tarique Rahman, won a landslide victory in the first election since a deadly 2024 uprising, the Election Commission said Friday, winning a majority of more than two-thirds in the country's parliament. Senior BNP leader Ruhul Kabir Rizvi claimed a “sweeping victory”.

items.title: Tarique Rahman promises era of clean politics as Bangladesh holds first election since fall of Hasina
items.standfirst: Jailed then exiled in London, Rahman returns home as the main contender to be next prime minister of BangladeshTarique Rahman, who after 17 years in exile is the main contender to be the next prime minister of Bangladesh, has pledged to end entrenched corruption and put the country on a “new path” as voting began in the first free and fair elections in almost two decades.Speaking to the Guardian before polls opened on Thursday morning, Rahman promised a new era of clean politics, including a “top down, no tolerance” approach to graft, if his Bangladesh Nationalist party (BNP) was brought to power. Continue reading...
items.content: Jailed then exiled in London, Rahman returns home as the main contender to be next prime minister of BangladeshTarique Rahman, who after 17 years in exile is the main contender to be the next prime minister of Bangladesh, has pledged to end entrenched corruption and put the country on a “new path” as voting began in the first free and fair elections in almost two decades.Speaking to the Guardian before polls opened on Thursday morning, Rahman promised a new era of clean politics, including a “top down, no tolerance” approach to graft, if his Bangladesh Nationalist party (BNP) was brought to power. Continue reading...

items.standfirst: It's the first election since the 2024 Gen Z uprising that toppled Bangladesh's long-serving prime minister Sheikh Hasina.
items.content: It's the first election since the 2024 Gen Z uprising that toppled Bangladesh's long-serving prime minister Sheikh Hasina.

clusters.title: High court rules ban on Palestine Action is unlawful – live
clusters.neutral_headline: UK Ban On Palestine Action Ruled Unlawful

items.title: High court rules ban on Palestine Action is unlawful – live
items.standfirst: Protest group’s co-founder wins legal challenge; home secretary ‘disappointed’ by ruling and says government will appealThe high court upheld two grounds of challenge, including that the ban was a disproportionate interference with the right to freedom of expression and freedom of assembly.The president of the king’s bench division, Dame Victoria Sharp, sitting with Mr Justice Swift and Mrs Justice Steyn, said that “Palestine Action is an organisation that promotes its political cause through criminality and encouragement of criminality”, but that proscription was still “disproportionate”.I am disappointed by the court’s decision and disagree with the notion that banning this terrorist organisation is disproportionate.“The proscription of Palestine Action followed a rigorous and evidence-based decision-making process, endorsed by parliament. The proscription does not prevent peaceful protest in support of the Palestinian cause, another point on which the court agrees. Continue reading...
items.content: Protest group’s co-founder wins legal challenge; home secretary ‘disappointed’ by ruling and says government will appealThe high court upheld two grounds of challenge, including that the ban was a disproportionate interference with the right to freedom of expression and freedom of assembly.The president of the king’s bench division, Dame Victoria Sharp, sitting with Mr Justice Swift and Mrs Justice Steyn, said that “Palestine Action is an organisation that promotes its political cause through criminality and encouragement of criminality”, but that proscription was still “disproportionate”.I am disappointed by the court’s decision and disagree with the notion that banning this terrorist organisation is disproportionate.“The proscription of Palestine Action followed a rigorous and evidence-based decision-making process, endorsed by parliament. The proscription does not prevent peaceful protest in support of the Palestinian cause, another point on which the court agrees. Continue reading...

items.title: Britain's High Court says government illegally banned Pro-Palestinian group
items.standfirst: In its ruling, the court said an earlier decision to ban the Pro-Palestinian group Palestine Action as a terrorist organization was "disproportionate."
items.content: In its ruling, the court said an earlier decision to ban the Pro-Palestinian group Palestine Action as a terrorist organization was "disproportionate."(Image credit: Kirsty Wigglesworth)

items.title: UK ban on Palestine Action was unlawful, says court
items.standfirst: The UK’s High Court has ruled that the government ban on Palestine Action was unlawful.
items.content: The UK’s High Court has ruled that the government ban on Palestine Action was unlawful.

items.title: UK's decision to ban Palestine Action as terrorist group was unlawful, court rules
items.standfirst: The UK government's decision last July to ban the protest group Palestine Action as a terrorist organisation was unlawful, Britain's High Court ruled Friday. British police have arrested more than 2,000 peaceful protesters for holding signs declaring their support for the proscribed group.
items.content: The UK government's decision last July to ban the protest group Palestine Action as a terrorist organisation was unlawful, Britain's High Court ruled Friday. British police have arrested more than 2,000 peaceful protesters for holding signs declaring their support for the proscribed group.

items.title: UK decision to ban Palestine Action as ‘terror group’ unlawful, court says
items.standfirst: Group's co-founder declares ruling 'monumental victory' in the struggle for freedom for the Palestinian people.'
items.content: Group's co-founder declares ruling 'monumental victory' in the struggle for freedom for the Palestinian people.'

items.title: UK ban on Palestine Action unlawful, high court judges rule
items.standfirst: Protest group’s co-founder wins legal challenge against decision to proscribe it under anti-terrorism lawsThe co-founder of Palestine Action has won a legal challenge to the home secretary’s decision to ban the group under anti-terrorism laws.The proscription of Palestine Action, which categorised it alongside the likes of Islamic State, was the first of a direct action protest group and attracted widespread condemnation as well as a civil disobedience campaign defying the ban, during which more than 2,000 people have been arrested. Continue reading...
items.content: Protest group’s co-founder wins legal challenge against decision to proscribe it under anti-terrorism lawsThe co-founder of Palestine Action has won a legal challenge to the home secretary’s decision to ban the group under anti-terrorism laws.The proscription of Palestine Action, which categorised it alongside the likes of Islamic State, was the first of a direct action protest group and attracted widespread condemnation as well as a civil disobedience campaign defying the ban, during which more than 2,000 people have been arrested. Continue reading...

ai_summary: UK High Court rules ban on Palestine Action is unlawful
Court says ban is disproportionate interference with freedom
Home secretary disappointed by ruling and will appeal
Ban was imposed due to group's promotion of criminality
Protest group's co-founder wins legal challenge

items.title: Japan seizes Chinese fishing boat inside its economic zone amid Beijing rift
items.standfirst: Japan says vessel failed to comply with order to stop, with incident coming weeks after row with China over TaiwanAuthorities in Japan have seized a Chinese fishing boat and arrested its captain in a move that is likely to inflame an ongoing diplomatic row between Tokyo and Beijing.The seizure, which occurred on Thursday about 105 miles (170km) from the south-western port city of Nagasaki, came after the skipper refused an order to stop for an onboard inspection, according to media reports. Continue reading...
items.content: Japan says vessel failed to comply with order to stop, with incident coming weeks after row with China over TaiwanAuthorities in Japan have seized a Chinese fishing boat and arrested its captain in a move that is likely to inflame an ongoing diplomatic row between Tokyo and Beijing.The seizure, which occurred on Thursday about 105 miles (170km) from the south-western port city of Nagasaki, came after the skipper refused an order to stop for an onboard inspection, according to media reports. Continue reading...

items.title: Japan seizes Chinese fishing boat and arrests captain
items.standfirst: Japan seized a Chinese fishing boat Thursday and arrested its captain, authorities said Friday, alleging that the boat was sailing inside Japan's exclusive economic zone. Beijing has called on Tokyo to respect the rights of the vessel's Chinese crew members.
items.content: Japan seized a Chinese fishing boat Thursday and arrested its captain, authorities said Friday, alleging that the boat was sailing inside Japan's exclusive economic zone. Beijing has called on Tokyo to respect the rights of the vessel's Chinese crew members.

clusters.title: Fresh crew takes off on flight to International Space Station
clusters.neutral_headline: NASA Crew Launches To International Space Station

items.title: Fresh crew takes off on flight to International Space Station
items.standfirst: The two-woman, two-man crew is replacing four other station fliers who came home early last month due to a medical issue one was having.
items.content: The two-woman, two-man crew is replacing four other station fliers who came home early last month due to a medical issue one was having.

items.title: On their way! 4 people on NASA Crew-12 mission launch to International Space Station
items.standfirst: The four people are set to dock with the I.S.S. on Saturday, returning the orbital lab to its full complement of seven. NASA's last mission, Crew-11, left a month early due to an ill crew member.
items.content: The four people are set to dock with the I.S.S. on Saturday, returning the orbital lab to its full complement of seven. NASA's last mission, Crew-11, left a month early due to an ill crew member.(Image credit: SpaceX via NASA)

items.title: Live: French astronaut Sophie Adenot blasts off to International Space Station
items.standfirst: NASA and SpaceX launched four astronauts to the International Space Station on Friday, replacing a crew that left early in the first medical evacuation in the station's history. Sophie Adenot is only the second French woman to travel into space. Follow our blog for the latest updates.
items.content: NASA and SpaceX launched four astronauts to the International Space Station on Friday, replacing a crew that left early in the first medical evacuation in the station's history. Sophie Adenot is only the second French woman to travel into space. Follow our blog for the latest updates.

items.title: NASA, SpaceX Crew-12 mission prepares for launch to International Space Station
items.standfirst: NASA and SpaceX say they have completed their final reviews and are ready to launch a crewed mission to the International Space Station on Friday. Retired NASA astronaut Leroy Chiao joins "The Daily Report" to discuss.
items.content: NASA and SpaceX say they have completed their final reviews and are ready to launch a crewed mission to the International Space Station on Friday. Retired NASA astronaut Leroy Chiao joins "The Daily Report" to discuss.

ai_summary: Four astronauts launch to International Space Station

clusters.title: Trump revokes landmark ruling that greenhouse gases endanger public health

items.title: Trump revokes landmark ruling that greenhouse gases endanger public health
items.standfirst: The White House calls it the largest deregulation in US history, but environmentalists say it will prove costly for Americans.
items.content: The White House calls it the largest deregulation in US history, but environmentalists say it will prove costly for Americans.

items.title: Why revoke the 'endangerment finding'? #science
items.standfirst: What the decision does and why it matters The Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) has rescinded its 2009 determination that greenhouse gases endanger public health and welfare — a legal finding that for years provided the scientific basis for U.S. limits on carbon pollution. That 2009 conclusion…
items.content: What the decision does and why it matters The Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) has rescinded its 2009 determination that greenhouse gases endanger public health and welfare — a legal finding that for years provided the scientific basis for U.S. limits on carbon pollution. That 2009 conclusion…

items.title: What does repealing the endangerment finding mean? #science
items.standfirst: Revoking a foundational scientific determination reshapes the U.S. regulatory footing The Environmental Protection Agency has rescinded its 2009 scientific finding that greenhouse gases endanger public health and welfare. That determination has been the legal and scientific linchpin for federal…
items.content: Revoking a foundational scientific determination reshapes the U.S. regulatory footing The Environmental Protection Agency has rescinded its 2009 scientific finding that greenhouse gases endanger public health and welfare. That determination has been the legal and scientific linchpin for federal…

items.title: Trump scraps legal basis for climate rules
items.standfirst: It's been billed by the White House as the "largest deregulatory action in US history". US President Donald Trump has formally revoked a landmark scientific finding that greenhouse gases endanger public health by driving climate change – a determination that underpins regulations aimed at curbing planet-warming pollution. The repeal is expected to be swiftly challenged in the courts. FRANCE 24's Sharon Gaffney speaks with Meredith Hankins, federal climate legal director at the US-based NGO, National Resources Defence Council.
items.content: It's been billed by the White House as the "largest deregulatory action in US history". US President Donald Trump has formally revoked a landmark scientific finding that greenhouse gases endanger public health by driving climate change – a determination that underpins regulations aimed at curbing planet-warming pollution. The repeal is expected to be swiftly challenged in the courts. FRANCE 24's Sharon Gaffney speaks with Meredith Hankins, federal climate legal director at the US-based NGO, National Resources Defence Council.

ai_summary: Trump revokes landmark ruling on greenhouse gases
EPA rescinds 2009 determination on public health and welfare
Decision is largest deregulation in US history
Environmentalists say move will prove costly for Americans
Repeal is expected to be challenged in courts

clusters.title: Shares in trucking and logistics firms plunge after AI freight tool launch
clusters.neutral_headline: AI Freight Tool Launch Sparks Logistics Sector Sell-Off

items.title: Shares in trucking and logistics firms plunge after AI freight tool launch
items.standfirst: SemiCab platform by Algorhythm, previously considered a ‘penny stock’, sparks ‘category 5 paranoia’ across sectorShares in trucking and logistics companies have plunged as the sector became the latest to be targeted by investors fearful that new artificial intelligence tools could slash demand.A new tool launched by Algorhythm Holdings, a former maker of in-car karaoke systems turned AI company with a market capitalisation of just $6m (£4.4m), sparked a sell-off on Thursday that made the logistics industry the latest victim of AI jitters that have already rocked listed companies operating in the software and real estate sectors. Continue reading...
items.content: SemiCab platform by Algorhythm, previously considered a ‘penny stock’, sparks ‘category 5 paranoia’ across sectorShares in trucking and logistics companies have plunged as the sector became the latest to be targeted by investors fearful that new artificial intelligence tools could slash demand.A new tool launched by Algorhythm Holdings, a former maker of in-car karaoke systems turned AI company with a market capitalisation of just $6m (£4.4m), sparked a sell-off on Thursday that made the logistics industry the latest victim of AI jitters that have already rocked listed companies operating in the software and real estate sectors. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Democrats at Munich security summit to urge Europe to stand up to Trump
clusters.neutral_headline: Democrats To Urge Europe To Stand Up To Trump

items.title: Democrats at Munich security summit to urge Europe to stand up to Trump
items.standfirst: European leaders divided over how far to accommodate Trump’s ‘wrecking ball’ politics and foreign policyUS Democrats will use a security summit this weekend to urge European leaders to stand up to Donald Trump, with the continent divided over how to keep the unpredictable US president on side.Democrats at the annual Munich Security Conference will include some of Trump’s most outspoken critics, such as the governor of California, Gavin Newsom, the New York congresswoman Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, the Arizona senator Ruben Gallego and the Michigan governor, Gretchen Whitmer. Continue reading...
items.content: European leaders divided over how far to accommodate Trump’s ‘wrecking ball’ politics and foreign policyUS Democrats will use a security summit this weekend to urge European leaders to stand up to Donald Trump, with the continent divided over how to keep the unpredictable US president on side.Democrats at the annual Munich Security Conference will include some of Trump’s most outspoken critics, such as the governor of California, Gavin Newsom, the New York congresswoman Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, the Arizona senator Ruben Gallego and the Michigan governor, Gretchen Whitmer. Continue reading...

items.title: AOC to offer a 'working class' perspective on U.S. foreign policy at Munich summit
items.standfirst: Democratic Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez to offer foreign policy vision at the Munich Security Conference as speculation grows about a presidential or Senate run.
items.content: Democratic Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez to offer foreign policy vision at the Munich Security Conference as speculation grows about a presidential or Senate run.

ai_summary: Democrats to urge Europe to stand up to Trump
European leaders divided on how to accommodate Trump
Democrats will attend Munich Security Conference
Governor of California and Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez will attend
Democrats will push for European leaders to take a stand

clusters.title: EU leaders back major economic overhaul to counter pressure from US, China and Russia
clusters.neutral_headline: EU Leaders Agree On Economic Overhaul Plan

items.title: EU leaders back major economic overhaul to counter pressure from US, China and Russia
items.standfirst: European Union leaders on Thursday agreed on an action plan to overhaul the bloc’s economy and boost competitiveness amid pressure from US President Donald Trump, China and Russia. European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen said the March plan would upgrade energy grids, deepen financial integration and ease merger rules.
items.content: European Union leaders on Thursday agreed on an action plan to overhaul the bloc’s economy and boost competitiveness amid pressure from US President Donald Trump, China and Russia. European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen said the March plan would upgrade energy grids, deepen financial integration and ease merger rules.

items.title: EU leaders agree to move ahead with ‘Buy European’ policy
items.standfirst: Ursula von der Leyen promises action plan to boost and protect sectors including defence, AI and clean techEU leaders agreed to move ahead with a “Buy European” policy to protect “strategic sectors” of European industry, at a summit on how to secure the continent’s future in a more volatile global economy.At a moated castle in the east Belgian countryside, the EU’s 27 leaders gathered on Thursday for a brainstorming session on how Europe could regain its economic competitiveness relative to the US and China at a time of economic threats and political turbulence. Continue reading...
items.content: Ursula von der Leyen promises action plan to boost and protect sectors including defence, AI and clean techEU leaders agreed to move ahead with a “Buy European” policy to protect “strategic sectors” of European industry, at a summit on how to secure the continent’s future in a more volatile global economy.At a moated castle in the east Belgian countryside, the EU’s 27 leaders gathered on Thursday for a brainstorming session on how Europe could regain its economic competitiveness relative to the US and China at a time of economic threats and political turbulence. Continue reading...

ai_summary: EU leaders agree on plan to overhaul economy
Plan aims to boost competitiveness and energy grids
EU will deepen financial integration and ease merger rules
Move is in response to pressure from US, China, and Russia
European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen promises action plan

clusters.title: Who beat Chloe Kim for halfpipe gold? #sports
clusters.neutral_headline: Choi Ga On Wins Olympic Gold

items.title: Who beat Chloe Kim for halfpipe gold? #sports
items.standfirst: A 17 year old shocks the halfpipe hierarchy South Korea’s 17 year old Choi Ga on won Olympic gold in the women’s snowboard halfpipe at Milano Cortina 2026, denying Chloe Kim a historic third straight Games title. Choi delivered the winning performance on her Olympic debut, while the American star…

items.title: Choi, 17, denies Kim historic third halfpipe gold
items.standfirst: Seventeen-year-old Choi Ga-on denies American great Chloe Kim snowboarding history as she brushes off an early fall to win Winter Olympic halfpipe gold.
items.content: Seventeen-year-old Choi Ga-on denies American great Chloe Kim snowboarding history as she brushes off an early fall to win Winter Olympic halfpipe gold.

ai_summary: Choi Ga On wins Olympic gold at 17 years old
Choi defeats Chloe Kim in women's snowboard halfpipe
Choi delivers winning performance on Olympic debut
American star Chloe Kim denied historic title
Choi wins gold at Milano Cortina 2026 Olympics
